Due to a [lack of native R support for Zarr](./local_data_overview.html), we currently use [reticulate](https://rstudio.github.io/reticulate/) to convert data to Zarr via the ``zarr`` Python package.

We recommend using [conda](https://docs.conda.io/en/latest/) with the following ``environment.yml`` file:
```
name: vitessce-r-env
channels:
 - conda-forge
dependencies:
 - python>=3.8
 - numpy>=1.14.0
 - pandas>=1.1.2
 - anndata>=0.7.4
 - zarr>=2.5.0
 - numcodecs>=0.7.2
 - pip
 - pip:
   - ome-zarr>=0.2.1
```

Create the conda environment in the terminal:
```
conda env create -f environment.yml
```

Then, in R, specify this environment for reticulate:
```
library(reticulate)
use_condaenv("vitessce-r-env", required = TRUE)
```
